item.title: *sigh* its been so long since ive edited safe zones i forgot how to :\
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Okie, since I like proving people wrong I’ll do so. It’s in a .txt file I like to keep stuff in;

[center]Server IP : comein.servegame.com

Server Port : 43594 [/center]

[center]That’s all you need to know. Come and play, this is the test before the release. The people who play now will be keeping their accounts. I’ll be adding shops and stuff every so often, not much though. If you need any help on anything just tell me. The point of this is to get you’re feedback. I wan’t to know if this is any good. Also, post any glitches you find. Thanks and enjoy.[/center]

Additional Features/Information : It has full Smithing, Firemaking, Fletching and much more!

bluurr:

can u rep me up 1 cause im going for cm i gave you 3 so you can now rep other people

Purpose : To answer you’re question (5 Minute tut ftw)

Difficulty : 1/10

Assumed Knowledge : Searching blah-blah-blah…

Server Base : Any

Classes Modified : client.java

Procedure
Step 1 - Attack : [i] Go into you’re client.java and search for case 823:

You should see something like this below it if (actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("You Attack The Dummy."); setAnimation(0x326); addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[0]), 0); addSkillXP((300*playerLevel[3]), 3); addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[18]), 18); actionTimer = 12; } break;

To change the experience gained just change the 150, 300 and the other 150.

Step 2 - Strength : [i] Go into you’re client.java and search for case 1531:

Below that you should see something like this if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) { if(actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("You start hitting the door"); actionTimer = 20; setAnimation(0x326); addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[2]), 2); addSkillXP((300*playerLevel[3]), 3); addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[18]), 18); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } } break;

To change the experience ganied again, change the 150 and the 300.

Step 3 - Defence : [i] Go into you’re client.java and search for case 299:

You should see something like this below it [code]if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) {
if(actionTimer == 0)
{
sendMessage(“You Dig In The Stack And Get Xp!”);
addSkillXP((150playerLevel[1]), 1);
addSkillXP((150playerLevel[18]), 18);
actionTimer = 20;
setAnimation(0x320);
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}
}
break;

Again, change the 2 150’s to alter the experience gained.[/code]

Step 4 - Magic : [i] Go into you’re client.java and search for Varrock

Until you see something like this below it [code] {
teleX = 3489;
teleY = 3288;
addSkillXP((20*playerLevel[6]), 6);
newheightLevel = 0;
}

 if (s == "Falador")
 {
    teleX = 2964;
    teleY = 3378;
    addSkillXP((30*playerLevel[6]), 6);
    newheightLevel = 0;
         
 }

 if (s == "Lumby")
 {
    teleX = 3222;
    teleY = 3218;
    addSkillXP((40*playerLevel[6]), 6);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }

 if (s == "Camelot")
 {
    teleX = 2757;
    teleY = 3477;
   addSkillXP((50*playerLevel[6]), 6);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }

 if (s == "Ardougne")
 {
    teleX = 2662;
    teleY = 3305;
    addSkillXP((120*playerLevel[6]), 6);
    newheightLevel = 0;
    
 }

 if (s == "Watchtower")
 {
    teleX = 2549;
    teleY = 3113;
    addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[6]), 6);
    newheightLevel = 0;
    
 }

 if (s == "Trollheim")
 {
    teleX = 2480;
    teleY = 5174;
    addSkillXP((400*playerLevel[6]), 6);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }

 if (s == "Ape")
 {
    teleX = 2761;
    teleY = 2784;
    addSkillXP((400*playerLevel[6]), 6);
    newheightLevel = 1;
 }
if (s == "Paddewwa"){

    teleX = 3131; 
    teleY = 9912;
    addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[playerMagic]), playerMagic);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }

if (s == “Senntisten”){

    teleX = 3312; 
    teleY = 3376;
    addSkillXP((200*playerLevel[playerMagic]), playerMagic);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }

if (s == “Kharyrll”){

    teleX = 3493; 
    teleY = 3485;
    addSkillXP((25*playerLevel[playerMagic]), playerMagic);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }
if (s == "Lasaar"){

    teleX = 3007; 
    teleY = 3477;
    addSkillXP((350*playerLevel[playerMagic]), playerMagic);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }
if (s == "Carrallangar"){

    teleX = 3161; 
    teleY = 3671;
    addSkillXP((400*playerLevel[playerMagic]), playerMagic);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }

if (s == “Annakarl”){

    teleX = 3288; 
    teleY = 3886;
    addSkillXP((550*playerLevel[playerMagic]), playerMagic);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }

if (s == “Ghorrock”){

    teleX = 3091;
    teleY = 3963;
    addSkillXP((650*playerLevel[playerMagic]), playerMagic);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }[/code]

To change the experience gained by teleporting each time, change all the numbers with *'s next to them.

Step 5 - Range : [i] Go into you’re client.java and search for case 2514:

You should see something like this below it if(actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("You shoot at the target."); actionName = "range1"; actionTimer = 30; setAnimation(426); addSkillXP((7*playerLevel[4]), 4); addSkillXP((5*playerLevel[18]), 18); addItem(3272, 1); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } break;

Again, change the numbers with the *'s beside them to change the Range experience gained.

Credits : ME ME ME

Purpose : To make safezones in Pimpscape and all it’s children, Phonescape etc.

Difficulty : 2/10

Procedure
Step 1 : [i] First of all we need to find the boolean. Search for this in client.java public boolean nonWild

[i]You should see something like this below that if((absX >= 3249 && absX <= 3258 && absY >= 3438 && absY <=3431 ) || (absX >= 3249 && absX <= 3260 && absY >=3435 && absY <=3437 ) || (absX >= 3249 && absX <= 3253 && absY >=3431 && absY <=3437 ) || (absX >=3250 && absX <=3257 && absY >=3419 && absY <=3423 ) ||(absX >=3250 && absX <=3257 && absY >=3419 && absY <=3423 )||(absX >=3156 && absX <=3277 && absY >=3374 && absY <=3514 )||(absX >=3456 && absX <=3582 && absY >=3249 && absY <=3327 )|| heightLevel == 1) return true; else return false; }

Step 2 : [i] Now that you’ve found the boolean, we can add the safezone! This is the format you use when making one (absX >= [X Coords here SW] && absX <= [X Coords here NE] && absY >= [Y Coords here SW] && absY <=[Y Coords here NE] ) ||

Step 3 : Save client.java and compile, congratulations on just making a safezone!

Credits : Me and n0vamage

Additional Information : [i] If you didn’t understand step 2, then pay attention!

The way safezones work is… You work out the most SW (South-Western) coords of the area you wan’t to make a safezone and add the X coords in the 1st place, put the Y coords of them in the last one. For the NE (North-Eastern) part of the safezone, you add the X coords of the position in the 2nd place and the 2nd last place.[/i]

Example : Say this square is you’re area that you wan’t to make a safezone.
__________
| | < NE Corner
| |
| |
| |
SW Corner >|________|

You’re adding in the SW corner’s coords and the NE coords so that the ‘safezone box’ can stretch out and cover the full area. Hope you understand now. :rolleyes:

Moderators : You’ll find a tutorial on adding safezones in this section somewhere, there isn’t one for Pimpscape though, only for Testscape and the Testscape tutorial isn’t compatable with Pimpscape so, please think about all the people this might help before attempting to lock it. Please, I’m here to help and help I shall.

That’s just some of it.

Read full topic

[i]You should see something like this below that if((absX >= 3249 && absX <= 3258 && absY >= 3438 && absY <=3431 ) || (absX >= 3249 && absX <= 3260 && absY >=3435 && absY <=3437 ) || (absX >= 3249 && absX <= 3253 && absY >=3431 && absY <=3437 ) || (absX >=3250 && absX <=3257 && absY >=3419 && absY <=3423 ) ||(absX >=3250 && absX <=3257 && absY >=3419 && absY <=3423 )||(absX >=3156 && absX <=3277 && absY >=3374 && absY <=3514 )||(absX >=3456 && absX <=3582 && absY >=3249 && absY <=3327 )|| heightLevel == 1) return true; else return false; }

Step 2 : [i] Now that you’ve found the boolean, we can add the safezone! This is the format you use when making one (absX >= [X Coords here SW] && absX <= [X Coords here NE] && absY >= [Y Coords here SW] && absY <=[Y Coords here NE] ) ||

Step 3 : Save client.java and compile, congratulations on just making a safezone!

Credits : Me and n0vamage

Additional Information : [i] If you didn’t understand step 2, then pay attention!

The way safezones work is… You work out the most SW (South-Western) coords of the area you wan’t to make a safezone and add the X coords in the 1st place, put the Y coords of them in the last one. For the NE (North-Eastern) part of the safezone, you add the X coords of the position in the 2nd place and the 2nd last place.[/i]

Example : Say this square is you’re area that you wan’t to make a safezone.
__________
| | < NE Corner
| |
| |
| |
SW Corner >|________|

You’re adding in the SW corner’s coords and the NE coords so that the ‘safezone box’ can stretch out and cover the full area. Hope you understand now. :rolleyes:
